TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TraceContextEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides a collection of trace records to any method that handles the event. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.TraceContextEventArgs> class is used by the <xref:System.Web.TraceContext> class to provide access to trace records after all the tracing information is gathered during HTTP request processing. By adding an event handler delegate to handle the <xref:System.Web.TraceContext.TraceFinished> event, you can process the records, record them to your own data store, or provide them as input to a profiling tool.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how you can register a <xref:System.Web.TraceContextEventHandler> delegate to handle the <xref:System.Web.TraceContext.TraceFinished> event. In this example, the `OnTraceFinished` method accesses the collection of <xref:System.Web.TraceContextRecord> objects through the <xref:System.Web.TraceContextEventArgs.TraceRecords%2A> property, iterates through them, and writes them to the response stream.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[System.Web.Trace_3#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Trace_3/CS/form3cs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[System.Web.Trace_3#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Trace_3/VB/form3vb.aspx#1)] -->

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Collections.ICollection records) cil managed

Docs.param: A collection of objects that represent all the trace records logged for the current request.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, using the provided collection of trace records.
Gets a collection of messages that are associated with the current request.
Docs.value: A collection of trace records that are associated with the current request.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Every call to the <xref:System.Web.TraceContext.Write%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Web.TraceContext.Warn%2A?displayProperty=fullName> methods generates a <xref:System.Web.TraceContextRecord> object that is added to the <xref:System.Web.TraceContextEventArgs.TraceRecords%2A> messages collection. The <xref:System.Web.TraceContext.Warn%2A> method call sets the <xref:System.Web.TraceContextRecord.IsWarning%2A> property to `true`, while the other method calls set it to `false`.
You can iterate through the <xref:System.Web.TraceContextEventArgs.TraceRecords%2A> messages and examine records with specific categories or messages, and whether they are warnings.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how you can register a <xref:System.Web.TraceContextEventHandler> delegate to handle the <xref:System.Web.TraceContext.TraceFinished> event. In this example, the `OnTraceFinished` method accesses the collection of <xref:System.Web.TraceContextRecord> objects through the <xref:System.Web.TraceContextEventArgs.TraceRecords%2A> property, iterates through them, and writes them to the response stream.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[System.Web.Trace_3#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Trace_3/CS/form3cs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[System.Web.Trace_3#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Trace_3/VB/form3vb.aspx#1)] -->
